thread.title: Jetstar thanks rival Virgin Australia for becoming a premium carrier
thread.title_full: Jetstar thanks rival Virgin Australia for becoming a premium carrier

author: Robyn Ironside National Aviation Writer
title: Jetstar thanks rival Virgin Australia for becoming a premium carrier
text:
VIRGIN Australia’s move to become a premium carrier may have been the best thing to ever happen to Jetstar.
Group CEO for the low fares carrier, Jayne Hrdlicka, told the CAPA Aviation Summit, Jetstar’s off-peak passenger numbers have never been better, thanks to Virgin Australia.
“Core, passionate, loyal Virgin customers have been abandoned in Virgin’s move to be a second premium carrier in our marketplace and we can see it in our numbers,” said Ms Hrdlicka.
“When Virgin moved to create a bundle price that competes with Qantas, meaning when you pay for your ticket that includes baggage and food, that move pushed customers out of Virgin to Jetstar because Virgin just became too expensive.
“We’re happy to be in the market spot that we are.” Jetstar Group CEO Jayne Hrdlicker says the airline has strengthened in recent times. Picture: Getty Source: Getty Images
Ms Hrdlicka said all of Jetstar’s businesses had improved their performance. In particular Jetstar Japan where the group was planning to open another 12,000 sales kiosks.
The kiosks are located in convenience stores across Japan, because that is where people are comfortable in buying an air ticket, she said.
Jetstar Japan’s mascot Jetta had also struck a chord with the local market, attracting more than nine million followers on social media.
“We’re looking at the market through the eyes of our customers,” Ms Hrdlicka said.
In the coming year, Jetstar would completely overhaul its website but not as a result of criticism from consumer groups about sneaky cost add-ons and extras.
Ms Hrdlicka said the redesign had been two years in the planning and would make the site much more consumer friendly.
“None of us would enjoy the experience (as it stands). It just takes too long, and is too cumbersome,” she said.
“It doesn’t give us the ability to create fast and effective purchasing by customers online.”
The new look site would allow travellers to customise their journey from beginning to end and get the best deals on everything from parking at the airport to hire cars and hotels.
